entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 1:06PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Rivers Through the Weekend... Numerous rain showers through Saturday will cause rises in creeks and rivers in the Western and Central Brooks Range through the weekend. Additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is expected over the Western and Central Brooks range through Saturday. People in the Western and Central Brooks range and along
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued July 05 at 12:43PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rises on the Chilkat River by Friday... A heat wave will cause temperatures to soar into the mid 70s and 80s starting Thursday and continue through Sunday. Warmest temperatures are expected Friday with a greater than 85% chance for temperatures greater than 75 degrees. With these warm temperatures, ice and snow melt at elevation will increase runoff into the Chilkat River Basin.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warming Temperatures through Saturday... Confidence is increasing that a marine layer will develop along the coast through the weekend. This could cause daytime high temperatures to be lower than areas who do not see the marine layer develop. At this time there is a greater than 90 percent chance that temperatures will warm to the upper 60s along the

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warming Temperatures Will Bring Rises to the Taiya River... As temperatures warm into the upper 70s and even low 80s on Friday, increased snow melt and glacial runoff will cause the Taiya River to rise. There still exist some uncertainty on how high the river could rise, but there is a increasing likelihood that the Taiya could reach bankfull by Friday. Looking into the weekend, there

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warming Temperatures Thursday through Sunday... There is a high potential for near record high temperatures soaring into the upper 70s and 80s throughout the Panhandle starting Thursday and continuing through Sunday.
